Articles.Content: Quick question: Which is bigger, Bop or Gilly?

I think its bob from experience, on gilly I found it hard to even get down because the gravity is so low, most of the time I was floating but on bop it was a bit easyer.

An interesting point about both moons is that the "follow the retrograde" landing technique does not work as the moons are spinning so fast you actualy travel sideways due to the rotation.

also, when I touched the surface of gilly slowly I instantly exploded, anyone know why?
Bop. I think it's about 50km vs. Gilly's 26km
Gilly has collider problems. Remember when Minmus was first introduced? Yeah, that.
Thank you, I already landed on Gilly and found it a challenge due to it's low gravity and wondered if I'd have a harder time with Bop, I'm a little bit disappointed lol
Nova once referred to Gilly as the smallest object in the Kerbol system, so it's probably it.
